metadata.title: CVE-2016-9922 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
The cirrus_do_copy function in hw/display/cirrus_vga.c in QEMU (aka QuickEmulator), when cirrus graphics mode is VGA, allows local guest OSprivileged users to cause a denial of service (divide-by-zero error andQEMU process crash) via vectors involving blit pitch values.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9922` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-block-extra - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-guest-agent - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-kvm - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-system - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-system-aarch64 - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-system-arm - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-system-common - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-system-mips - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-system-misc - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-system-ppc - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-system-s390x - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-system-sparc - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-system-x86 - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-user - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-user-binfmt - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-user-static - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2
qemu-utils - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: qemu package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu2').
